page.title: 15HOUSING
page.content: The Manor had a reliable gas supply at the beginning of the century. In the cellar is the first oil boiler to be installed in Devon. There were no washing facilities until the 1930's. There are 12 bedrooms but now we only use 5. In the building beside the house there is an organ loft built in 1890. The entertainments room was built later with a stage. It was used as the Village Hall until the present hall was built in 1976. The army used the house during the two wars and we think that they built some of the out houses.There is still an ammunition store (empty) in the little copse. The garden includes the old kitchen garden which was given to the school as a playing field.
